title.narrative: F.a: Transport Corridors in West Africa

description.narrative: Through this project a regional collective agreement is negotiated for West African transport sector, covering all important transport corridors and the minimum terms and conditions of employment.The road transport sector has grown rapidly over the last fe w years due to economic globalisation in West Africa. Privatisation, deregulation and outsourcing have fragmented the company structures in the sector. This causes a rapid change in the employment contracts towards precarious employment such as temporary a nd short-term employment. For the employees in the sector this means a weakening in terms and conditions of employment, living standards and occupational safety as well as an increasingly hostile and anti-trade unionism environment among employers. When lo bbying becomes challenging the number of members decreases, which in turn leads to trade unions losing their influence in society. The project aims at strengthening trade unions’ collective bargaining and thereby improving the terms and conditions of emp loyment. After the first phase of the project West African transport sector trade unions have negotiated regional collective agreements covering the minimum terms and conditions of employment in all the countries and are monitoring the implementation of th e agreements. Furthermore, the recruitment and membership services have become more effective and the knowledge on interest representation has increased at workplaces (border, bus stops and truck rest stops).Beneficiaries of this project are organisers, ne gotiators, officers and activists of the local trade unions. The rank and file members benefit from the project in the form of better terms and condition of employment.The project is implemented by transport sector global union International Transport Work ers’ Federation ITF.
